title: The Life cycle of the malaria parasite
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Medicine - Study and teaching
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Malaria
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Medicine - Research
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Medicine
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Medicine - Study and teaching
description: Explains how the female mosquito bite a human being and infects them with the malaria parasite. Shows how it lodges in the liver and develops. Explains the two types of 'tertian' and 'qurtan' fevers. Very technical terms are used to explain the redevelopment of the parasites within the mosquito and the many forms of the parasite Presents in animation exoerythrocytic and erythrocytic schizogony and gametogony in man, and sporogony in the Anopheles mosquito; pictures the differential characteristic of plasmodia in thin and thick blood films.
